author: Shiv Sunny
text:
The boy drowned in a water tank at a Delhi school

Four days of questioning in the case of drowning of a six-year-old boy in a water tank at Vasant Kunj’s Ryan International School led to the police finally arresting the principal and four other staff members on Thursday.

All the arrested were released on bail.

Besides the principal, Sandhya Sabu, others arrested are class teacher Minakshi Kapoor, the school’s drinking water system operator Yogesh Kholiya, the maintenance in-charge of the tank Puran Singh Bisht, and gardener Ram Narayan.

Investigators said their probe suggested several negligence acts such as allowing the boy Divyansh Kakrora to loiter in an unsafe place and not keeping the area locked.

Whether norms were flouted in the construction of the water tank, located below the school’s amphitheatre, was being probed, said the officer.

The boy’s body was found in the water tank on Saturday, sometime after he went missing. Police were informed of the incident by hospital authorities and not the school, prompting the boy’s parents to suspect a conspiracy.
title: Principal, four employees arrested for boy’s death
